These make her feel better.

It absorbs so nicely. My skin is left feeling very soft and firm. I love the ingredients. It's definently been a great addition to my skin regimen. I recommend trying it.

profile.title: Very good but contains alot of fragrance
profile.text:
I was excited to try this serum because I tried one other skincare product from Winky Lux and I was very impressed. First let's say this packaging is unbelievably beautifully with gorgeous dissolvable orchid petals in the serum. This is a hydrating balancing serum. It makes my skin feel very soft, it works well with my other skincare products and under makeup.
Now the ingredient list is a tiny bit disappointing when I look how far down some of the really fantastic ingredients actually are. The real reason I took off a star is because. I personally don't love putting alot of fragrance on my skin. Fragrance (parfum) is listed midway down. The scent I admit is lovely very floral. The scent lasts a long time. So I decided to use this on my decolletage (my chest area) I usually like to bring my skincare down into that area anyway. This way the strong yet beautiful floral scent is there but so is the skincare benefits. I recommend this if you don't mind putting alot off fragrance on your face. If it didn't contain so much fragrance I would have given this 5 stars and yelled "GET IT" from the roof tops, because it does make my face feel so soft!

profile.title: Works really well but it's a bit too pricey
profile.text: I absolutely love a really good brightening mask. This mask feels very good on my skin. It yields very nice results. I'd use this before an occasion where I need to look my best. I used at night at night and it was easy to use. It didn't slide everywhere. I saved all the serum to apply to my skin the next few nights. Yes this is a very good mask. About as good as a $10-$12 mask. Which is a tiny bit pricey for a single mask for the average person. Now as good as it is $26 at time of this review is way too much for this mask. The products great and like another reviewer said if you have the disposable finances then go for it.

profile.title: Pleasantly surprised!
profile.text: I have used this de-stressing cream both am and pm. I usually don't use something like this during the day bc I try to keep my products to a minimum. For this reviews sake I used this during the day under my makeup and it looked good. Now I use this at night. We expose our skin to alot of stresses in the environment and at night our skin rejuvenates. So I feel this is great to use while I sleep. This jar may seem small but a little goes a long way so it should last some time. It's not greasy, spreads across my face easily, and it absorbs well. It's very hydrating and it doesn't leave a shine on your face. I do use this sometimes during the day if I'm not wearing any makeup. (Like I said it looked good under makeup, I just don't use a separate moisturizer on makeup days I use a few other products and it'd be too much) Anyway when I wake up in the morning my skin really feels good. It's soft, smooth, and supple. It even has a bit more bounce back of you know what I mean. I'm impressed with this cream. It's fragrance free and doesn't irritate my skin which can be mildly sensitive. So I definitely can say I recommend it.

It could be I'm just too delicate but I won't be using this regularly.  Maybe I can remove the rod somehow so it's not a total bust...

profile.title: So Easy to Do it Yourself
profile.text: This really helps to calm down my frizzy wavy grey hair. I have bought it several times, and I can get 2 treatments out of one box (but I do have shorter hair). Now this product does just what it says "Tames your Main", it will NOT make your hair poker straight. If that's what you're looking for then go to the salon. This does have a "perm-ish" smell to it that lingers a day or so, as does most perms, but it's not that bad. I left it on for the maximum time since my hair is resistant. It really cuts down on my styling time, and I don't have to go crazy with the flat iron. Maybe just a few swipes. It last on my hair about 2-3 months maybe more. I would absolutely recommend this to anyone who wants to smooth out the tangles and coarseness of your hair and save some time on having to style.

profile.title: Good product
profile.text: Hylo-Care drops are very soothing and it's nice that they're free of preservatives.  As other reviewers have noted it does take some practice to dispense the drops so they go in your eye and don't run down your cheek.  I've also used the Hylo-Forte drops which have double the amount of  Hyaluronic Acid (0.2% vs. 0.1%).  I prefer the latter for nighttime use since they're a bit thicker but both are good products and highly recommended.  The packaging claims there are 300 drops per container.  I haven't actually counted but it's probably fairly accurate - you do get an ample amount so the cost per drop isn't prohibitive.

profile.title: Mehh...
profile.text: I thought I would enjoy this Coconut Scrub but I found it to be just okay... like nothing fabulous I have been using this for three weeks before I gave this review to really make my opinion... maybe because I really wanted to like it. First off the scent is not appealing to me, like yeah it smells like Coconut but then there this weird scent that smells like fake products like that scent kids play makeup has.... I did how soft it left my skin but at the same time my skin felt to Oily. The one reason I almost gave it a 4 was because I like how concentrated it was. But the cons out weigh the pros so it's a 3 star for me. Maybe I might try a different scent and see how that goes.

profile.title: Grainy and non-oily
profile.text: I feel like the scrub is granulated which is what I prefer instead of heavy oil based prdouct. Don't get me wrong, it still has oil but just the right amount. Therefore, there isn't a need to use so much product in one time use and the clean up is much easier! I wish all brands emulated this when it comes to body scrubs. Also, the coconut smell is just divine ! 🤭

profile.title: Easy to Remove the Top!!
profile.text: I love this razor. Mostly because it is so easy to remove the top which holds the shaving heads. These guys don't use those silly clips to reinstall the head; they use magnets.....pure genius!! What took the razor industry so long to fix this problem??? I am a huge fan, and it gives a great shave.

profile.title: AMAZING
profile.text: I can’t believe how well this worked for me. I’ve used countless products for my feet and STRIDE is definitely the most effective. After the peel and the cream, my feet feel baby soft. I definitely recommend this product

profile.title: THICC
profile.text: I have purchased SO MANY foot creams over the years, and this one is gorgeous. It is so thick and creamy! I put it on under cotton socks before bed, and my feet looked much better the first morning. I'm only three days in, and they are so much more smooth and soft. This will be replacing the peeling masks, cheese graters, and other creams I have stockpiled over the years!!

profile.title: Thicc
profile.text: It is suggested to use this cream coupled with Stride's foot peel masks, so I did. My feet feel amazing. I'm bummed that the cream is unscented but I love how thick it is. It really smoothes dry cracked feet. Not to say mine were the worst but they most definitely needed some love.

profile.title: Um what?
profile.text: This thick af band with velcro was uncomfortable, hard to blow dry the lace thru, and stuck to the glue. 3 stars because it came with an edge brush, a comb, and 3 of those mediocre wraps. Will be shopping around for a different brand.

profile.title: A foot cream that works.
profile.text:
I tried Stride’s foot peel and was amazed that it worked so much better than the drugstore and big box store versions. So I ordered the cream.
Smells great, not greasy, and my feet are very soft. Definitely better than those heavy creams.
Worth the price.

profile.title: Best moisturizer ever! Period!
profile.text: Until I used the STRIDE foot cream, I had never experienced a moisturizer which actually worked for more than several hours and required repeated application.  Not only did this cream moisturize the site immediately, but contained ingredients that continued to work for 1-2 days after the initial application. Significantly better than any ointment or petroleum based product Ive ever used including Aquaphor, vaseline etc. This stuff is legit. My skin stayed silky smooth and it had a durable moisturizing effect. In fact, the skin probably was smoother on day 2 after use, which was kind of mind blowing I am extremely impressed with this product. I am recommending this to all my friends and family.

It helps smooth & keeps foot looking great. The product is medicated & I do not want to make it a habit of using it daily, especially if I don’t need constant mending on my feet.  I would prefer a foot lotion that maintains your foot soft.

profile.title: Moisturizing foot cream that lasts for long time but is mildly greasy.
profile.text:
This foot cream does a very nice job of moisturizing your dry feet and heels. It only takes a very small amount of the cream to cover you entire feet. As a result, this tub goes a long way. The cream is non-scented which I prefer for my feet and prevents having a lingering scent on my feet during the day. The one negative for the cream is that it does have a mildly greasy feel.
Pros:Nice moisturizing dry feet
Non-scented
Goes long way
Cons: Greasy

profile.title: Apply small amount for soft feet
profile.text:
Pros: This foot cream makes your rough skin feel softer. It also does not take much cream to do the job, so the container will last a long time.
Cons: My feet feel a little greasy inside my socks and shoes after using the foot cream
Tip: Apply cream to feet at bedtime so they have all night to soften before you have to go out with shoes on again.

profile.title: Summer Feet Will Thank You
profile.text: This foot cream is just what my summer feet were asking for.  I put it on right out of the shower and it absorbs well.  I find it’s best to use at bed time right before laying down to give it time to sink in.  It does not have a greasy feel or any strong smells and does not stain my sheets.  It leaves my skin softer and smoother especially on the bottoms of my feet.  I believe it is also helping to soften the callousness on some of my toes and my heels from running and walking with bare feet all summer.  The container is good sized and I think will last me quite a while.  The price seems consistent with similar higher end products on the market.

profile.title: Awesome Mineral Sun Block - Minimal White Cast
profile.text: [[VIDEOID:4b406aa76d91a65ac04175ceaf355c1e]] Absolutely love this mineral based sunscreen.  Since I’m kind of allergic to chemical based sunscreen, my main go to is zinc based mineral products.  I go through a lot since I’m on the water paddling, running or walking 7 days a week.  Since zinc is my go to, I’ve leaned to live with just being white all the time (not my natural skin tone).  I was pleasantly surprised to find that this sunscreen did not cause any allergies/ break out on my skin.  In addition, it went on so smoothly and left very little white cast.  There is a sort of mineral smell to it but I am fine with it and prefer it over fake coconut or perfume smells of other chemical based sunscreen products.  It’s a nice consistency and very smooth.  Once rubbed in, I could hardly tell it was on.  It was not greasy or sticky.  I went out on an hour walk in 90 degree heat and then paddled the the next day for two and a half hours on and in the water wearing it and got zero burn.  The price is great too.  Very reasonable for a two pack of quality mineral based sun protection lotion.  It is EXACTLY what I was looking for in a sunscreen.  Of all the sunscreens I’ve used recently, this one is my new favorite.  I will definitely repurchase when this two-pack runs out.

profile.title: Questionable ingredients
profile.text:
When I read the product page, it sounded like this foot cream had some of the same ingredients as some of my favorite lotions, so I thought it would help soften my rough, cracked feet. It wasn’t until the package arrived that I saw what was REALLY in this product, and I was NOT pleased. However, I was willing to give it a try.

Aside from the aloe, green tea leaf extract, water and coconut oil, many ingredients in this cream are kind gross or not helpful. The complete list is: urea, salicylic acid, deionized water, green tea leaf extract, coconut oil, dodecane, cetearyl alcohol, polysorbate 60, clyceryl stearate, PEG-100 stearate, cetyl alcohol, aloe barbadensis leaf juice, tea tree oil, glycerin, propylene glycol, carbomer, xanthan gum, ethylhexylglycerin caprylyl glycol, hexylene glycol, phenoxyethanol.

The gross part is the main ingredient: 40% urea—a major component of urine. Salicylic acid is used in wart-removing solutions because it exfoliates your skin. Dodecane is a chemical used in jet fuel which can cause skin, eye, and respiratory tract irritation. Alcohol dries out your skin. Xanthan gum is just a thickening agent made of corn. I am personally allergic to that and stearates. And the other chemicals are kind of sketchy, too.

I tried this stuff on my feet for a couple of weeks, applying before I went to bed and wearing socks to protect my sheets. I really didn’t see any significant change in the condition of my feet than when I apply regular alcohol-free lotion. It makes no sense to me that anyone would use this stuff so full of questionable chemicals, paying $27 for a little pot of this cream, when a regular bottle of lotion works just as good or better and goes for a fraction of the cost.

profile.title: Really helps moisturize your feet
profile.text: Living in the Midwest my feet tend to get dry and cracked in the winter. This foot cream works very nicely I'm keeping my feet from cracking. I like the consistency of this as it is a thicker cream and tends to absorb better into the skin. I have found that if I put this on my feet and then put socks on right before I go to bed my feet are much softer once I wake up. Because the cream spreads very nicely over the skin I have found that I don't use very much of it and the tub has been lasting for quite some time. I'm very pleased with this and will probably be purchasing it again.

profile.title: Not all natural!
profile.text:
I'm giving this one star for false advertising! When I ordered this, I thought it was an all-natural. However, not all ingredients are listed. It's primarily a high dose of Urea 40% and includes salicylic acid (2%) and other chemicals. See the ingredients on the packaging. For this reason, I have downgraded my rating. Nor are there any warnings in the description or on the packaging to keep away from eyes, mouth, and lips and wash your hands thoroughly after applying. As effective as urea is and it's generally recognized as safe, there are some warnings about breast feeding as well.

I know that urea and salicylic acid are excellent compounds for skin softening and can be used for things as serious as psoriasis, especially at that amount. I haven't used this for two weeks as I felt my warning was important, but I know it will be effective, having used urea/salicylic acid compounds in the past with great results of softening calluses and dry heels.

If the correct ingredients were listed, I would give this a higher rating. I just don't like the deception!

profile.title: Sweet scent not enough staying power for me
profile.text: First off I don't really think of cotton candy much when I smell this scent and I've tried nearly every cotton candy scent everything from Aqualina pink sugar to gale hayman delicious cotton candy to bodycology to yes even that iconic cotton candy we all wore as a teen by body fantasies. It's more closer to a vanilla scent but with a strong almost caramel-y tone to it, it reminds me far more of vanilla bean noel by bath and body works rather than most if not all cotton candy scents I've ever tried. Not a bad scent but for me I need my sweet Gourmond scents to be stronger than this and last much longer than 30 minutes to 1hr at best. If you love a quality sweet smell that's stand alone this might not be for you I think a 3.5 would be more fair it's close to a 4 but just not quite for those reasons. However I don't regret this buy I use it to top up other scents since it's nearly a brown sugar vanilla sort of caramel scent it goes well with most sweet scents (strawberry pound cake, Scarlett kiss, dark kiss, Oahu coconut, Hawaiian hibiscus etc) to intensify it but-- cannot really for me last alone if I rebought it it would be to use as that-- a topper scent. Also, not a bad scent for someone wanting a cheaper dupe for Eilish but again not as strong and not as lasting. So I'd bet a younger lady such as a teen or preteen would like this one vs myself who likes a sweetsie scent I just need it stronger, more longer lasting.

profile.title: Last longer than Prettia bubble hair dye
profile.text:
(5BR Wine Red) I like this color very much, it's a purple under tone red wine color. After about a month it has become lighter brownish warm red wine color. Different lightings show different colors, sometimes red wine, sometimes brown, but not as purple.
Before I dyed my hair, I had medium brownish color with Asian black on the roots, and it was about three months after I used Prettia Provence Rose bubble hair dye. Prettia bubble hair dye is more gentle but doesn't last long compared to this one. You can see from the pictures. After a month, it's still with good color even though it has changed the color into lighter brownish red.

Con
The only problem I found about this hair dye is that it's a strong bubble hair dye. The smell is fine for me, but if you accidentally leave it on your skin, you might want to wash it out right away. It can stain on your skin very quickly. (I think that's the reason it last longer than Prettia.) However, you can always apply thicker lotion on your whole face, neck, and arms before you dye your hair. It can protect you from being exposed to the chemistry. Last note, if you have sensitive scalp or have wounds on your scalp, this hair dye might not be good for you.

Beside the minor problems, I will still buy this again because I prefer long lasting bubble hair dye. Even though the chemistry is strong, it is not as strong as traditional hair dye. Hopefully, more colors are available.
Hope you find this review helpful!

profile.title: Wish I discovered foam hair dye sooner!
profile.text:
[[VIDEOID:fcbd656abc9c0b52e4b95ff1f8cf0752]] I've been dying my hair (mostly purple) for the past 10 years. Wanted to try something different and after lots of searching, I came across this. I honestly wish I knew about this foam dye sooner because it was so easy to dye and also the box has gloves and a plastic cape.

The solution was very easy to mix and at first, I was confused why the liquid wasn't foaming inside the bottle so I swirled it a bit more. But that was unnecessary as it comes out as foam from the dispenser. I have very long hair down to my lower back, and this bottle covered all of it and I still had some leftover.

After leaving it on for 40 minutes (I didn't hear my 30-min timer), washed it with shampoo and the serum that comes from the box. I was left with a very nice reddish/purple color. The top half of my hair is my natural black and suprisingly it tinted that too. Very happy with the results and glad I bought a 2nd box.

I sleep on my face and my eyelashes get pressed up straight up when I'm sleeping. When I wake up they look a hot-mess. The Lashify curler did not help me with this problem due to what I needed to do to fix my problem (no clip to hold lashes). I can first pull the lashes down at the base to have the correct angel again after waking up, and then once they are at the right angle coming off my eyes, I can curl the tops out of the straight mess they become when sleeping.
The whole device is made out of hard plastic including the tip. Holds my lashes well. $10 less than lashify curler too. Wish I had never purchased the lashify one now.
This product had good reviews until recently. It's been in my wishlist until this past week and when I purchased, I did not realize the reviews had gotten so bad. Not sure what is up with this.
It is true that you have to curl your lashes in segments with this curler, and can't to the full lash with one curl, so if that is what you are looking for, this is not the right choice for you.

profile.title: A nice variety of wispy/fluffy lashes!
profile.text:
I’m so happy with this lot of lashes! I normally avoid buying multi-style sets, but with these, each style is “similar enough”. For example, I prefer wispy lashes and I’d say each style is a variation of that — some are thicker, some longer, some are cat eye, but if you like one, you’ll most likely be fine with the others. Usually these multi-style sets have too much variety, and I don’t end up liking them all.

In this set, you get 10 different styles of fluffy, wispy lashes, which I think are perfectly in the middle of being too natural looking and too fake looking lol. People might be able to tell you have fake lashes on bc they look too perfect and glamorous, but they aren’t too “over-the-top”. Most of these can be worn during the day or for a night out, which I like. In my photo I am wearing the bottom left style, which you can see in my other photo.

I had to cut off a little from the strip to fit my eye lid, which is typical with strip lashes. The band is thick and sturdy, so you can wash these with a gentle cleanser and wear them multiple times! I’ll def be buying these again bc it’s hard to find multi-style lash sets that I like.

profile.title: Glam Cat Eye Lashes!
profile.text:
These are cute super glam cat eye lashes! Def not “natural looking” if that is the look you are going for, but they aren’t ridiculously over-the-top either. Perfect for when you want a more glam look and don’t care if people might think you have fake lashes on lol.
The strip is very long, and they are cat eye style, so the lashes gradually gets longer towards the end of the strip. I had to cut off close to 1/4 inch, which is something I normally do with fake lashes. I cut from the longer end, and they still looked plenty long (see photo). The band is also very thick, so if you are careful with them and use a gentle wash, you can get several wears out of each strip!

profile.title: If you factor in the low price, 5 stars
profile.text:
This is a fantastic wig for the price. I have been wearing it daily for 2 months now. I have washed it twice and have no complaints on how it's holding up.

It has average tangling by the end of each day, but always brushes out well, with minimal shedding. The bangs are a little short for my liking, but that's a matter of personal preference.

My one and only complaint is that at the crown, the stitches show. I have to spend a minute or so each morning brushing it just so in order to cover that little spiral. Hiding it is possible, but it takes time. I knocked a star off due to that.

I have bought a few wigs now at this price point, but this was the first that looks as natural as a $250 wig with minimal work. At $60 or so for 18 inches, I highly recommend this wig.

profile.title: Gentle, natural, and cleans well
profile.text:
I love this moringa and aloe based cleanser! It made my skin feel and look very soft. Sometimes I even skipped moisturizer as it was very moisturizing on its own. It worked well getting all the gunk-of-the-day off, and still being very mild and soothing as well. Even if you get a little bit in your eye, it doesn’t burn.

Taking care of my skin, especially my face is very important, and I do not want to put anything carcinogenic or harmful on my skin. This cleanser checked all the “excellent” boxes for me, ingredient-wise. And, generous portion for the price, it will last a long time with the handy pump action bottle. I’ve already gone through one bottle, but it took a long time. These days, with so many big corporations and wanting to spend my hard earned money more wisely, I also really like that this business is women owned. Who else can make a product for women as good and as thoughtful as this one than other women. Love it!

profile.title: My dry skin loves this toner so much!
profile.text:
If you have dry to super dry skin your skin would love it. I love toners so much and it’s very important for my skincare routine. I tried so many different toners including Celimax Noni Toner. But this one… it’s a top notch product for my super dry skin!!

It moisturizes my skin soo good without drying out. To me it’s not heavy at all but it’s not too light either which I prefer. It’s probably in between.

It plumps and hydrates my skin all day, my large pores which were a big part of my concern for years got shrunk, it soothes my skin, and I rarely have hormonal acne since I started to use it. It’s so perfect for me and I feel like finally found a right one!! Hydration is the key to shrink pores and plump which make you look youthful!!

Noni toner is more popular than this one from the same company but for me this Sedum essence wins!! Plus Noni cream with the sedum essence seems working really well to shrink my large pores!

My favorite skincare routine▼

Make p:rem milk Cleaning
Anua heartleaf toner (2 layers)
Celimax Real Sedum Essence (3 layers)
Ample N Ceramide Shot Ampoule
Celimax Noni Cream

profile.title: Only kind of worked
profile.text:
I keep looking for a cheaper option than the $25 Baby Foot. That is the only foot peel that's ever really worked for me. This one -- not so much.

It took about 8-10 days before I saw any peeling. Then it was agonizingly slow. I had gross scaly feet for a good two weeks, and even when they finally looked better, they still had some flaking on the sides. And when the peeling stopped -- only about half of the bottom of my feet had peeled. Since this came in a five-pack, I just applied a second one to see if it does any more, but I won't be buying this one again.

Only con i have is my husband is 6ft3 size 12. It was a tight fit but I'll be purchasing these again.!

profile.title: It works
profile.text: My wife made me buy these foot scrubs. The truth is, I didn't have much faith in them, especially since I didn't know this brand. It is very impressive, there it says that the feet will begin to peel in 3 to 5 days, but my skin began to peel the next day, little by little. My recommendation is that if you are going to use it, put a lot of cream on your feet during the peeling process, otherwise the skin is tight and itches a lot.

profile.title: Mixed review - read for thoughts/cautions
profile.text: Very hard to write a fair review on this product.  (1) yes, it will activate the peeling of a layer or two, and usually with in a couple of days, (2) product design is a bit cumbersome to use (a plastic bag bootie that has the ooze inside that is a bit of a struggle to get on your foot, and (3) because the goo inside is all over the plastic bootie, it not only gets on the bottom of your feet, but all over your entire foot (bottom, top, ankle, etc.).  As a result of #3, not only did my entire foot feel tight and tingly for days, but the product created a very irritable rash on the tops of my feet. The rash has been there all week and still hasn't subsided.  This would be a much better product if you could just put it on the bottoms of your feet or where the dry/calloused skin is.  If I every use it again, I will put it on a plastic mat or something and just allow the bottoms of my feet to be exposed to the goo or rub it on the needed areas with a plastic glove.  NEVER again will I put it on as a sock/bootie and now I just hope the tops of my feet heal.  (I put the product on Saturday evening, the attached photo is from Wednesday and the top of my feet look worse today, Friday)

profile.title: VERY Good
profile.text:
I've used several different shampoo bars to help reduce the plastic waste in my household. I have long plain hair, usually in a pony tail and I never blow dry, let alone straighten or curl. My point is that I don't really expect much from my shampoo beyond cleansing. But this B.O.B bar kinda blew my mind. The first time I used this bar, my hair was very very dirty with excise sweat and DAYS of dry shampoo buildup. I was totally expecting to wash twice for a complete cleanse. But after the first rinse, my hair felt really clean AND moisturized. I typically apply conditioner to the bottom half of my hair, I Rarely skip this step because my hair usually feels a bit roughed up from the shampoo. Again, I have long hair and I wash maybe twice a week. For the first time EVER, my hair felt plenty moisturized after just one wash with the B.O.B bar, so I skipped the conditioner.
My Hair dried SO BEAUTIFULLY. Its soft and has volume. I didn't even need to run a brush through it. I gave up on these type of results a long time ago, especially after transitioning from bottles to bars. All I really came to expect was clean hair. But the BOB bar far exceeded my expectations. I purchased the Purify Bar.
And its a good value. Its frustrating to see bars so expensive, how does anyone expect the average woman to do away with the plastic when they can buy like 4 bottles of shampoo from the grocery store for the cost of 1 bar?
Anyway, I 100% recommend this product. Thank You B.O.B <3

profile.title: I'm impressed.
profile.text: First time user of bar shampoo and conditioner. I was pleasantly surprised how easy it was go get it to lather and how nicely it cleaned my hair without stripping it. I'm not a fan of the strong scent but it doesn't linger once its dry so I can deal with it. It just smells really strong like essential oils or something. But it did such a good job on my hair that its not a deal breaker. I'm also really sensitive to scents, way more than the average person, so it probably won't bother most people. And it didn't irritate my skin or cause hives like most fragrances do. This is the best shampoo I've tried for my typically oily, flat, dull hair. It looks better than its looked in years.

profile.title: Wow. Just wow.
profile.text: This is my first time using bar shampoo and conditioner and I honestly wasn't expecting it to be great. I have issues with my hair being really oily by the end of the day and I've been looking for something that gets rid of the oiliness without stripping my hair and causing a ton of breakage. This is the first one that has accomplished that, and I have tried a lot of different shampoos and conditioners in this price range. I was starting to think I wouldn't be able to find anything. The conditioner bar was easy to apply and it was very good at detangling. My hair is very fragile so if it gets a lot of knots in it, that always results in breakage. That did not happen with this conditioner. It left my hair shiny, soft and light, not weighed down with residue at all. I am going to stick with this one because its the best I've tried.

profile.title: Great natural shampoo/conditioner set!
profile.text: I am pleasantly surprised by how well this works. It leaves my hair feeling very clean but also well conditioned. That is a difficult balance to find in the cleaner, more natural shampoos/conditioners. Usually, it seems that products that clean well leave my hair a dry, tangled mess and products that condition well leave a lot of greasy residue. Not the case with this set. The smell is also nice. The shampoo smells more like orange and the conditioner smells more like chocolate. It is not overpowering and does not smell like someone sprayed perfume in my hair after its rinsed out. There is just a very subtle scent that my sensitive husband does not even notice. I hope this available for awhile, but if not I will be trying their other products.

profile.title: Holds up well, keeps my hair shiny
profile.text: I like this shampoo bar. The scent is nice and it is easy to work into a lather in my hair. It makes my hair super shiny. It holds up well between showers. I wish it was a little more moisturizing but I would buy it again.

profile.title: Love it!
profile.text: So easy to use and my hair looks and feels great. No more plastic bottles for me.

profile.title: Not my favorite
profile.text:
Let me preface this lil bar shampoo review with the following facts: i shave my head, and have very little hair, i also dont shower daily...
So this bar soap doesn't get used a ton.

Two people have been sharing the HiBbrandar shampoo bar for nearly a year in our household, and we are still not thru it.

I purchased this b.o.b.s. bar less than four months ago, and am the only one using it.
And This bar is disappearing at a much faster rate than the HiBar brand!!
It is a softer soap, (easily crumbles, etc.) than the Hibar brand and i think this contributes to how long lasting - or not - the bar is...
For the price, I will be switching back to the HiBar.
I also like the shape/angle of the hibar brand better than this classic round shape, it is easier to hold/use as it gets smaller.

profile.title: Love it!
profile.text: It took a few washes for my hair to balance out, but I absolutely LOVE this shampoo bar. It smells lovely and works exceptionally well at cleansing without stripping all the oil from my hair.

profile.title: Decent shampoo bar
profile.text: This shampoo bar works okay. I would not say it is the best out there, but I had had bad luck with the same brand's conditioner bar, and their shampoo bar works much better than that. It is not drying to my hair and seems to do good cleansing it. It smells really good and has a lighter scent. I would probably use this as one of my top two to get in the future.

profile.title: Not lathering for me, bar too hard
profile.text: I was really looking forward to trying this as it seems to be harder to find a conditioner bar than shampoo, but I am a little disappointed with it so far. I have been unable to get a good lather off of this because the bar is so hard. I am rubbing my hands about raw with it trying to get enough to use on my hair. I have really long, thick hair that takes a lot of conditioner, so this is a huge problem for me. I was wondering if it may be just because it is so cold right now, but I have other brands of shampoo bars that I use often and am having no issue with that with them. It smells good, and I will try again once it gets hot to see if that makes a difference. Right now, I would not buy this product.

profile.title: Decent hair ties
profile.text: This is the brand and type of hair ties I always get when the ones I have wear out. They are very sturdy under heavy use and stretch fairly well. They do tend to wear out after a bit of time, but that makes this value pack worthwhile so it will be a long time before you need to buy more. I have been using this brand for years and have yet to find anything else that holds my thick long hair well.

profile.title: Great shampoo

Great shampoo

profile.title: Extremely Impressed
profile.text: i have something between 2c/3a hair, with my curls always being dry and frizzy and my scalp oily and quick to form build up. i used whatever moisturizing shampoo for curly hair that was decently priced for years. i decided to stop with the matching shampoo and conditioner thing because well, my scalp doesn’t need moisturizing like that. with regular liquid shampoo, id have to wash my hair every other day at least, and going 2 days would leave my hair a greasy mess, any longer was even worse. I made the switch to this bar shampoo a month ago. I use the purifying bar, it is kinda small but pretty thick. I wanted to test the product for a decent amount of time and see if there were any noticeable changes, and there have been! I was a little confused the first attempt, I couldn’t get the bar to lather properly but by the second wash I had it down. The bar has a very light scent on my hair, the bar itself doesnt smell amazing but I dont care about that.  I noticed immediately that when my hair was dried it was incredibly soft, softer than with anything I've used before. I have also noticed that my build up is MUCH slower to come back, i went from having to wash my hair every other day to twice a week max! Very happy about that. There is no waxy feeling left on my hands or hair either. Overall very happy with this purchase, and i’ll be coming back for more when I run out (: I encourage  anyone thinking of making the switch.

profile.title: Love this bar soaps!
profile.text: This is a brilliant idea! I like the fact that we are not consuming much plastic and works great for my hair. It foams really well and love how my hair feel. It does take a couple of washes to get used too but once you do it's a game changer

profile.title: Great purchase!
profile.text: My husband and I have been using B.O.B shampoo and conditioner bars for over a year. We wanted to reduce the use of plastic and use something with less toxic ingredients. So far we love them! My hair is very healthy and cleans it very well. It takes a couple of days to get use to it if you are transitioning from liquid to bar bit it foams really well and nurtures your hair.

profile.title: Love this shampoo bar!

The smell is hard to deacribe, but it is such a pleasing aroma, and it was such a different experience altogether. I was deciding whether to use CBD shampoo or this, and im going to stick with this product 100%.

profile.title: Great for fine, oily hair
profile.text:
I have a decent amount of hair, but it’s baby fine and very oily. I love this bar! My hair never feels greasy by the end of the day.
As with all shampoos, I do a quick wash with a small amount to break up the oil, rinse, reapply with a little bit more and let it sit while I wash. Then I condition my ends and comb through.
The smell isn’t anything fancy, but I’m good with that. Love this for travel. Love it now for home, while saving plastic. I keep it in a draining dish.

It's  surprising how much it lathers up in my hair! This keeps the ends from drying out but gives me volume at the roots. I'm  liking this more and more.

profile.title: One word: FRESH
profile.text: I love this soap. I got the "Purify" scent and it's light and herbal. I have really thick hair and I've always had issues keeping it from getting oily between washes (every other day) and usually give up and just shampoo daily but with this shampoo I didn't need to! It kept my hair from getting oily between washes for up to 3 days (craziness) and kept it soft and lovely. The only downside to this shampoo bar is that it's different from other shampoos I've used in that it's SUPER difficult to brush your hair out while moist after using it in the shower. I recommend a leave in conditioning cream to help with that, I always have to use it to brush my hair out after a shower with this soap without breakage. Will def buy again!

profile.title: Great for oily roots but not good enough for the price
profile.text: These bars are a great way to care for the environment and a good way to keep yourself away from harmful ingredients.  I have been using BOB for over 2 years now. This bar specifically does feel like it purifies my hair and gets my oily roots soft and clean (lasts a day before I have to wash my hair again.) The only problem I have is that the prices of BOB bars went from $9.99 to $19.99 which has completely gone out of my budget for essentials, so had to move to a different company (bottles). If you can afford it go for it, but I feel that you might as well just go back to using bottles again if they do the exact same thing as this product. The soap also slips out of your hands a lot so having to pick it up off the floor is a bit icky.

profile.title: 360° SLIM Version (blue box) worth it for small dogs!!
profile.text:
Overall: The Company that makes these toothbrushes are a God-send, FOR REAL. Please don't stop manufacturing these!!

Review for: 360° DOG TOOTHBRUSH SLIM VERSION (Blue Box)
Use: 11lb. Senior Age Rat Terrier Chihuahua with highly sensitive gums and very yellow teeth.

My husband and I have searched high and low for 360 toothbrush to use on our little puppo since buying one while we were on our trip to Japan and was SO SO HAPPY to find this on Amazon! Our puppo's gums bleed very easily, she hates getting her teeth brushed and we needed a toothbrush that 1. Had narrower cylinder to brush her teeth more effectively and 2. Was soft and wouldn't irritate her gums.

This 360° SLIM TOOTHBRUSH brush, worked well. She doesn't mind it as badly as when we used the other competing toothbrushes but it was definitely a little bit more firm than the YELLOW SOFT TOOTHBRUSH made by this same company. There was some pink blood here and there but definitely not as bad as other toothbrushes we've used from other companies.
It was gentle still but firm enough to clean her teeth and the fact that it was 360° made it easier to clean her teeth.

As I said in my other reviews, we are looking forward to a cleaner bill of health for our sweet older puppo with these brushes! Please do not stop making these/selling these on here! The prices are very fair for $6.50~$7.00 per toothbrush considering these are imported!!

profile.title: Well, I had high hopes...
profile.text:
I have very thin, very fine, very curly hair and a small head… I STRUGGLE to find headbands that work for me. Headbands do not stay on my head unless I have a gallon of hairspray dumped on and then put the headband on top. Because my hair is so fine and curly, it gets damaged very easily from Elastic/ribbon bands, etc. so I was really looking forward to having a headband hold my hair in place will simply clipping it up. The first couple days with this headband were great… Then it started sliding so i washed it to try and get the tackiness back, and it seems like it’s done nothing... it’s sliding out of my hair just as much as if I didn’t wash it. The picture I have attached is after me wearing it for about two hours, chasing around my newborn, it completely slides up… And this is after I have fixed it at least once or twice. Disappointing :(

The colors are nice and it shipped fast.

profile.title: Not as I imagined it would
profile.text: If you can apply liquid eyeliner you can do these. They're super easy to use and fun! However, they seem to work/adhere best when the liner is still wet or they just dont seem to cling after the liner has been opened a couple times. I rolled mine instead of shaking to prevent air from being mixed (if its anything like polish). They definitely need to be washed between uses or if you want to remove them and realign the lash after it dries as it blocks the magnets. As far as comparing to other magnetic lashes, this is my first pair. If you compare them to other lashes with glue I would say it's fairly equal. If the glue lashes have the same application I dont see why those wouldnt do just as well. I expected to be able to remove the lashes and readjust as needed like taking a magnet off a fridge and reapplying. Not the case at all unless I'm somehow doing it wrong. Also, you cant really trim these down on the strips cuz it's not a magnet the entire strip, just a few spots. If you cut the strip the magnet could be cut off as well and wont lay flat on your eye.

profile.title: Not as big as they look

These don’t hold all my hair so I just use them for half up half down styles. They’re really cute I just wish they were 4.2 in long.

It was quite easy to arange the return and refund for this item. UPS dropped off the label, I repacked the item in the original box, labeled it and left it for pick up / next business day at the front sesk as per instructed by Amazon Prime. profile.title: Much better than the other wax I've been using and barely any scent! I'd def recommend.
profile.text:
Not sure if I really want to post a photo of the wax with all my armpit hair on it, but this was absolutely so easy to work with. I would definitely recommend this as it managed to get almost all the hairs minus a few stragglers, which compared to the other wax i used was 98% less hairs I'd be left needing to pluck after waxing. Crazy how much less wax I needed to get it all too.

A few things I noticed was that it was much harder to try and peel off thinner layers of wax if you applied it too thin. Also if you applied it too thick, it would be sticky to touch and sometimes harder to pull off with my nail extension unless it was fully cooled which I didn't have the patience for, honestly. I kind of had to rush so there was that as well.

Additionally, I know with waxing it sometimes takes a layer of skin off, now I'm not sure if what I experienced was the thin wax needing to be peeled off, or just a LOT of surface skin that was peeling. It didn't hurt to pull that "skin" off nor did it burn when I applied some ingrown hair oil and the cooling post shave balm from Nivea, but time will tell. I'm no professional by any means, BUT it was one of the best self waxes I've done aside from the old waxing strips that aren't made the same anymore from Veet (in the pink box, the old wax that was good was like a yellowy-orange-brown color. The new pink wax doesn't do much other than make my underarms horrifyingly sticky unless I bathed it in baby oil and soapy water and pull... yeah, was never easy or fond of those strips after those attempts)

All in all, I would definitely use this wax again every time as it was much easier to tolerate as it didn't really even have a scent either! My old wax had this particular smell that was always just ... not natural and I didn't get that at all with this wax. There was a mild scent when you open the bag but once the beads heat up I did not notice any at all, and if there was a scent, it was no where near as noticeable in my room whatsoever like my old wax beads.

profile.title: Great for migraines
profile.text:
I chose this particular mask by seedling because I suffer from debilitating migraines all the time. As someone who suffers from migraines I prefer to have heat on my face rather than cold this works wonderfully for what I will be using it for.

It came with two scented inserts which I was not expecting but I'm very glad that it did. It also came with ear plugs and a travel bag.

It was easy to plug up and get started, the package arrived in was small and well put together like a kit.

This would be a nice gift for someone who may just enjoy having something nice to sleep with.

The only thing that concerns me is I have to be careful not to fall asleep with it on because of the USB cord that must remain attached to it in order for it to be hot. You can however disconnect it and sleep with it just as a regular mask.

Overall I am very pleased with this product!

Q. Would I buy this again?
A. Yes!

profile.title: Good effective wax…
profile.text:
My wax arrived already melted and reformed in the bag, so I had one large chunk of wax instead of a bag full of smaller loose beans. I do see that other reviewers had the same problem, though I am choosing not to lower my star rating, as the package arrived on a particularly hot day this summer, so I was kind of expecting them to be melted even before I opened the package.

Once I got the single large chunk of wax out of the bag, I managed to cut it with a sturdy chef’s knife, resulting in me now having a number of large chunks of wax, and each of those chunks easily fits in the wax melting device. They don’t take much longer to melt in this larger block form, compared to how they would have melted in the smaller beans form, and they do melt fine and the result is the same. The wax has a familiar hair removal wax scent, smells similar to other waxes; it is not a strong odor. I warmed the wax to a honey-like consistency, and the wax then works just as well as any other wax, it is very effective, and feels comfortable on the skin. It is effective at removing course and fine hairs. Again, I would have much preferred this to have arrived in the unmelted bean form but I do think it was likely due to the hot weather. This is good wax. I like it.

profile.title: Works way better than the soak off method.
profile.text:
I love gel polish but I have always hated the removal process. Leaving clamps or wraps or tinfoil on my nails with acetone for 10-20 minutes always bothered me. It took forever and it never seemed to work well which left me to file it off or peel it. My nails hated me when I removed gel so I looked for a better option.

When I say this product saved my nails, I mean it. Just file off as usual, apply this like polish and let it sit for less than 10 minutes. It starts to bubble and comes right off with minimal effort. Now because I use 5 ish layers of gel it sometimes takes a few applications and the base coat sometimes will only come off in patches, however light buffing will fix that.

I am so glad I found this product because I now can wear my gels without fear of removal.

profile.title: Remover that works the fastest
profile.text: I have worn gel, shellac or dip nails for years. This product is the only thing that I have found that takes the gel off within about 15 minutes. I add a layer to all 10 fingers, and then add a second layer and then let it sit for 7 to 8 minutes. Probably about 80% comes off on the first attempt. I then put a third layer on the remaining for another five or six minutes and the rest comes off then. It does not work on dip nails and I have not tried it on shellac.  Way better than soaking your fingers in acetone.

profile.title: Works but takes time…
profile.text: So this product was interesting. I got a gel manicure for my engagement pictures and the salon did a wonderful job. My manicure lasted over 20 days and then finally began to chip. Which is where this product comes in. So I was skeptical but figured it was worth the $6 risk. It was extremely thick and gummy consistency which made it hard to paint on my nails. But after painted on and waiting a little (30 seconds maybe?) my nails began to tingle which kind of freaked me out. The thing about this product is that if you have a really good gel manicure with a lot of layers then this is a process. You have to wait 5 minutes then scrape off a layer then re-apply until you got all the layers. So it works, just not a quick process. So depending on your time, it might just be easier to go to the salon.

profile.title: PIGMENTED AND THICC!
profile.text: Iroiro is my new go-to for fun, warmer shades with serious lasting power! I have tried their 70 Pink, 100 Dark Red and pictured here the 105 Plum. These dyes are THICK and PIGMENTED!!!! They smell super good and go on very smoothly, I haven’t tried it diluted because I’m typically dying over my natural medium-light brown roots and whatever faded color is on my ends. I would definitely recommend this brand to anyone looking to refresh a salon job or dying over unbleached hair!

profile.title: Good dupe for bright pink
profile.text:
For some reason, the same brand's version of bright pink has been expensive lately, so I tried the plum + bubblegum pink. It took a few times to get the right brightness level and it's not an exact match, but I'm happy with the outcome color. It's worth noting though that it took a lot of lightening to get it right. I needed very little plum to create the color.

The picture is first week after dying, color only on top of non-treated, non-bleached hair. The difference between back and front is a function of color depositing on grey, an effect I like because it gives some variation and highlighting effects. For reference, my natural shade is auburn that's gone mousy and grey in old age.

profile.title: Very vibrant and pretty 🥰
profile.text: *covered face for privacy reasons* but yeah the color is very pretty ☺️

profile.title: This dye is lovely both in color and ease of use.
profile.text:
Put the Plum color on over hair previously colored Aquamarine and purple and I love the color. I literally only let this dye sit for five minutes and it came out so bright and even. Absolutely gorgeous color!

Be warned it did slightly stain my sink and bathtub, but a good foaming bathroom cleaner, some elbow grease, and a bit of time made quick work of getting rid of it.

The scent is very pleasant, and I also really enjoyed the ease of use and coverage of the dye.

I highly recommend doing a small patch test to make sure it's a color that will look good on you.

The dye came out exactly like the label on the package, absolutely beautiful.

profile.title: Powerful, but not easy to clean
profile.text:
I had never used a water flosser before so was not entirely sure what to expect with this the first time.
It takes a little bit of practice (well it did for me at least) to not get water everywhere, I found the water pressure to be a little forceful at first but learned how to maneuver it to get it where I wanted it to go. It does leave my mouth feeling incredibly clean and I much prefer this to using old-fashioned floss. The different attachment heads are very easy to switch out. The only thing I'm not crazy about is there is really no way to clean/dry the water reservoir between uses. I've followed another users suggestion to rinse out with an anti-bacterial mouthwash occasionally which I suppose is better than nothing.

profile.title: Okay
profile.text:
To date, I have tried a variety of methods to curl my hair with minimal success. Of the heatless methods, this product is my preferred go-to, though I still haven't mastered it. My experience with this product does not impact my review - my score is based on the overall use of the product itself.

Material;
Hair health is important especially when it comes to styling.
The rod and hair ties are silk which is a definite plus. However, for the health of your hair, you are sacrificing ease. The softness of silk creates slippage and combined with the length of the rod this causes difficulty when prepping the hair.

I am not complaining about the material itself - just stating it would be nice to have a way to ensure the product stays in place during prep.

Supplies;
The clip meant to hold the rod in place while prepping isn't my favorite, but this is due to personal comfort rather than a mark against the product. It just feels like it's pulling at my hair rather than holding things in place. For those who may have a similar experience, I suggest having other types of clips handy.

The rod itself is really long, which can be beneficial to ensure all of your hair can be wrapped. However, this length gets in the way. Securing the wrapped hair proves difficult with the amount of material you have to move the hair ties over. Wearing this product during the day is going to be awkward with any sort of head movement. With that being said, the rod itself is comfortable to wear, even while sleeping. I just wish there was extra fabric at the ends to allow for tying the rod out of the way.

Use;
Lastly the instructions are basic, so I suggest the use of tutorials to find what best works for you. Some things to consider for first-timers;
- Do not use wet hair. Damp to dry works best.

- Use some sort of product to help your hair keep shape, especially if it's heavy.

- There is a learning curve. Don't give up if you don't get it right the first few times. I'm still struggling to find the best way to achieve the look I want.

With my points in mind, I do recommend this product for those seeking heatless curls. The product itself is not bad - it just takes some practice to get used to.

profile.title: Great color and long wear.
profile.text: I am always on the hunt for a great stay put smudge proof lip color.  This is really a great option for my makeup bag.  The first thing that I saw that I really liked was that it is a US company. The packaging and colors really pop and the actual product worked great for me.  It went on really smooth and creamy and did not burn like some lip stains I have used in the past.  I wore it around the house, through a workout, eating dinner and drinking and by the end of the night the only wear that I could see was right in the center of my lips. I did notice that after a couple hours my lips were a little dry so a hydrator to accompany the color might be a great option.  At bedtime my makeup remover oil and a microfiber cloth took it right off. I would definitely like to try it in more shades so I will be ordering more in the future!

profile.title: Great for long hair

profile.title: It Curls But Material is slippery, too much movement
profile.text:
This heatless curler is ok, it’s as described and curls hair without having to utilize a curling iron. I find that it works best when using a light mist of water from a spray bottle and a texturizing spray.

It’s somewhat easy to use, but because it’s made of a silky material, it tends to slide around on my head and not stay in place.
The outside silky liner loosens, twists and loses its original shape after using it. I have a soft cotton one by another brand that works better, so in comparison, this one isn’t as good. It also doesn’t come with a headband to help keep hair wrapped and secure. It’s a bulkier wrap and leaves the top strands of hair looser which can cause the curls to not be as defined as they could be.

I started by putting the wrap at the top of my head, claw clipped it in place and moved strands of hair from the back of my head, underneath to the front and combined it with strands from the front, then continued to wrap the strands of hair around the wrap. I repeated this on each side until I was done. I used the hair ties at the ends to secure my hair in place. Getting strands of hair from the back to the front in sections can be a little complicated. With practice, it gets easier.

I let it sit in my hair overnight, it worked as described but left wavy/ loose curls rather than tight curls. It’s a good alternative for heat free curls.

profile.title: Love it!
profile.text: I had a Chi for many, many years and needed to replace it. I initially decided on the Chi Lava, which I ended up being very unhappy with. It pulled my hair, didn't get hot enough, and was just not up to the standards of my initial Chi. My hair dresser has L'ange straightener and was a previous Chi owner, as well. I decided to give this straightener a try and I could not be more impressed. I have had it a week and have already fallen in love with it. It heats up quickly, allows for heat control, shuts off after 1 hour of being on, leave my hair smooth and shiny, and doesn't pull it out while straightening! My hair is also holding the style throughout the day, which I also had difficulty with during the day. This is a great tool for getting your hair pin straight or going for the beachy waves/curls!

profile.title: Actually disappointed :(
profile.text: Not super impressed with this straightener. I was hoping spending a little more money than I usually would on a straightener would pay off, but I was disappointed. I’m giving 3 stars because it was shipped fast, and does heat up incredibly fast. It does go to 450 like it says. What I’m bummed about it that there is a constant clicking in the unit, and I can’t figure out what it’s coming from. I would say this is not best for color treated hair, as it is melting the color off of my hair and the straightener is covered in brown/black gunk after I’m done using it. It also pulls my hair when straightening, and doesn’t just glide right through it like cheaper straighteners I’ve purchased. Super bummed it’s not as great as I had hoped for :(

profile.title: So good!
profile.text: I almost never write reviews but this sincerely made my life so much easier. I love to have sparkly nails but I hate the process of removing the polish. This makes the removal process so quick and easy. It lasts a full week for me, which is the longest I leave polish on for before changing color. It took me a little practice because the first time I put it on way too thin but just paint like any other base coat.

profile.title: Absolutely perfect peel base!
profile.text: I love Sparkle & Co. products! I use this with my dip powder manis. Makes removal a snap and preserves my nail health. I like to change manis weekly and this let's me do that without acetone soaks (which I dislike). I use this on the center of my nail only and leave the edges bare. I find this is the best balance. If I use it on the edges the dip powder pops off within a day or so. Just having it the center though allows my dip to last a week - then I just tease the edges free and pop them right off. Easy peasy, lemon squeeezy!

profile.title: Literally perfect
profile.text: It came quickly, and it came in a cute pink box with a handwritten note and a sticker! I am 1000% satisfied. 10/10 will buy again.

profile.title: Unusable
profile.text: Delivered yesterday, opened today and it's completely dried out and solid inside the bottle. Hopefully this is not the norm and I just got a bad bottle.

profile.title: Freeze warning!
profile.text: This particular product is susceptible to freezing. If it is too cold out it may freeze during shipping. I ordered when it was a nasty cold snap here in Minnesota (high temp of -10 windchill -40) and I was so sad to find it had frozen during shipping and could not find a way to revive the product. It gelled up and stayed that way regardless of warming it. So if it’s brutal cold just hold off until it warms up a bit! Sparkles and co took great care of me when I reached out to them about it, also their packaging is so cute!

profile.title: Works fantastic

profile.title: Works as advertised
profile.text:
The first time I used this product, I did it exactly as directed. I do a lot of housekeeping, artwork, full grooms on my dog, but my manicure lasted over a week. I wanted to change colors at that point, so started picking at it. Since I was a little premature, it didn’t come off as easily as I hoped, but it was easier (and faster!) than other dip polish removal methods. It also didn’t add to the damage on my nails.
The second time I used it, I did two coats, but really don’t recommend that because my polish popped off randomly, with the first “pop” happening the next day.
Overall, I think it’s a good product that I will use regularly.

I don't like my brows to look dark, and super done if the rest of my face isn't. That said, there are many brow shapes to choose from, which is great. However, I found a few that basically matched my natural brow shape, with one in particular as my fave. I have used the stencils for my fave shape twice, and they aren't very stick anymore. Therefore, the issue is, once they won't stick at all, I will have to alter my natural brow shape to accommodate another stencil that I like. I will add that doing brows used to take as long as the rest of my face, and this literally takes 90 seconds, and boom baby!

profile.title: Lashes for daaaaaaaays
profile.text:
I always love the lashes from this brand. They are a great quality lash for a very reasonable price.

The lash band isn’t too thick so that it’s uncomfortable, or too thin that you can’t work with them. The lash band is sturdy, yet flexible. Very comfortable to wear on the eyes

The actual lashes themselves are fluffy & multidimensional. They are full, yet give good separation & length. They blend nicely with your natural lashes. Highly recommend

profile.title: Long & lush lashes
profile.text:
These lashes are lightweight & lush!! You’re not compromising comfort for style either.

You get 2 styles of lash, a more tapered lash that’s shorter towards the inner corner & gets longer towards the outer edge. You also get a style that is more the same length but adds so much volume to your lashes. I recommend stacking them together to get the best of both worlds

The value for the $$ was great since you get 2 styles of lashes. 8 pairs of each for a total of 16 pairs.

Highly recommend!!

profile.title: Strong and bad smell. It smells exactly like the Old Spice dad wore too much of in the 80s.
profile.text:
The item came in a white Amazon bubble package, and it had spilled everywhere inside the package due to a lose cap. I could smell it before I opened the package, and already knew I was not going to like this.

In the past, I used EMJ because I liked the clean, modern and mild scent of their mint products, but they have been impossible to find recently, so I've tried a few other products. Seems EMJ changed what they're about and are now making strongly spiced "vintage" scents instead of mild and modern scents.

I was previously using their scent-free facewash when I couldn't find mint, but I wanted to try something that would help my beard. This stuff got an extra start because I do like the way it cleans my face and beard. But that smell.

I guess I'm going back to scentless.

profile.title: Great for sensitive skin but leaves white cast
profile.text: I liked the formula, very mild, I can put it around my eyes and no burn, it’s also waterproof.  The only downside is that it leaves pretty opaque white cast.  I will go to the beach with a streaky white face, I don’t care, unfortunately I do not live by the beach and rarely go.  I can’t wear this to the grocery store or work because the white cast is so bad, maybe if I use just a tiny bit it won’t be so obvious but then that defeats the purpose of wearing sunscreen.  Definitely not fitting for those with a darker complexion.

profile.title: Not the best value but a great little kit.
profile.text: I feel like this is the perfect kit for people who are new to the water-line application method.  These are light enough that you can apply them under the lash line and they will look super natural, long and sexy.  However I don’t expect the amount of clusters to last me very long because you figure you use 6-8 clusters each time you put your makeup on. I haven’t managed to reuse these because they crumple when I remove them from my eye.  So I wouldn’t say it’s the best bang for your buck if you’ve already got tweezers and lash adhesive and eye makeup remover.  But if this is your first kit or you’re a beginner “eyelash wearer” then I think this kit is great.  Also, you don’t get two kits, you get one, but that is more me not paying attention to the description than it is a negative quality of this product.

profile.title: Disappointing
profile.text: They advertise the amount (11520) of crystals that you get but there’s no way of really knowing how much you’ve actually received.  They come in cheap plastic bags that are barely filled. One color is not enough to cover a full set of nails, if you’re sprinkling them like I am.  Pretty disappointed, I will have to buy more from a different shop in order to use them in the manner I intend.  Not worth the money IMO, plastic poor quality and low volume.

profile.title: The "HG" for Me
profile.text: I first learned about this sunscreen from No BS Beauty (a no-nonsense, non-sponsored skincare enthusiast on YouTube). I was looking for something with good staying power, good filters (beyond FDA archaic limits), and no scent/fragrance for both everyday and outdoor activity sun exposure.  This hits all the marks. I have maturing skin (almost 50), and use tret, so UV exposure protection is a must. I've repurchased this one throughout the year (2022). It has never failed me: long, multi-hour summer hikes, summer outdoor wedding, and now, just as an SPF make-up primer for everyday life (work, errands, etc). I would say it does leave a slight white cast on my medium-olive skin tone, but that disappears with my sheer BB cream or foundation. It leaves a not-quite matte, smooth/silky, almost powdery finish that I appreciate because, having maturing combo-skin, I cannot stand all those highly praised "dewy" sunscreens that make me look greasy moreso than "dewy."  If you're seeking "dewy," this isn't it. I wouldn't say it's matte or drying either -- it just hits the sweet spot for me. I am a bit of a skincare nerd who wants to try out lots of different sunscreens, and I have no doubt there are amazing alternatives out there, but when you find something that works? At least in my case, I end the hunt and just hit re-order. Make sure you check the seller's storefront and ratings (always recommend that when purchasing J or Kbeauty skincare products from Amazon). This one is definitely worth trying and adding to your collection!

profile.title: Love this sunscreen!

profile.title: coming from someone whose had pro 28 full body laser removal treatments and 50 hrs of electrolysis
profile.text:
Needless to say i have xp with hair removal. I was never really a super hairy but loved the feeling of being totally hairless from head to toe.

With all the sessions and hrs i barley have any hair but do have some spots on thighs, arms and other spots, that are fairly light even with all the professional laser treatments and electrolysis. IPL aka this device is NOT the go-to treatment for hair reduction but it does work.

Firstly, you need to use an electric razor or standard razor on the areas your zapping. Freshly showered, no oils or lotions on skin. If you dont feel heat your not killing hair follicles. The laser targets the pigment in the hair and absorbs the heat, so as they stated vampire skin, dark hair gets the best results.

If you have never gotten any sort of pro hair removal your hair is going to be fuller and courser. Like the subject heading states, ive had 28 full body laser hair removal treatments aka real hair removal that leaves you with red bumps, plus hrs of electrolysis and I still have hair grow back.

People it takes a long time to remove hair! This is not designed to be a one zap and the hair is gone. It will grow back finer and weaker, until it eventually is killed off. It literally takes years.

I zap each spot 5 times on the highest setting. The heat will build on each subsequent zap, meaning im actually hitting follicles. I would not recommend this if you have course hair or never had pro hair removal - build up to that, but this device is a nice supplement to the pro hair removal. It will never replace it and will take longer. For me its perfect and thats why i gave it 5 stars.

Once you zap the hair you should see a reaction, raised bumps, some redness, along the bikini line for example its very noticeable since the hair is courser - that means its working. It takes about 10 -14 days for the zapped hair to push its way out. Its not instant, the hair still remains in the follicle. You can expedite this by lightly exfoliating in the bath or shower. You may see little black spots in the follicle where the hair has been zapped and effectively targeted.

Hair grows in cycles, doing this every week is pointless, if the hair is not in the growth phase you cant kill it. Every 4 weeks, multiple zaps per spot and the hair WILL fall out and come back weaker. Different areas have different growth cycles but 4 weeks is a good middle ground.

This is used for hair reduction. If you want permanent (still takes multiple treatments( you need electrolysis.

If you want faster hair reduction result you need to use laser only found at the dermatologist or reputable laser spa. IPL is not laser treatment. This is not going to ever replace that. A combination of all three over 3 or 4 years will leave you hairless, so keep your expectations realistic.

profile.title: LIFELONG DREAM COME TRUE
profile.text: This is going to be a lifesaver for me. For 40 yrs I've struggled with chin and upper lip hair.  Back in the day it was way too expensive for a single mom to go to laser treatment which was the ONLY option.  I even had one girl call me out on my dark chin (I plucked but had the shadow by 5pm). Then, they came out with the at home devices but they were $359 on shopping channels and generated poor reviews. So, no luck there. By accident I ran across this having no clue they were now very affordable.  I couldn't believe it. Now, it's mine and after ONE treatment I already have a bald spot on my upper lip which makes no sense after my first try! THANK YOU for helping me regain some self-confidence. Plus, I NEVER leave reviews due to time constraints-but just had to come here and tell my struggle for so many years.

The liner had transferred from my eye line to the upper part of my eye in a neat little line on one eye. Less than 2h later it was also flaking off in great big chunks.

The colors are pretty and bold but they dont stay where they belong. On the upside, they do come off easily with Micelear water.

profile.title: New hair, who dis?
profile.text:
I love the color now but it took 2 tries and some bleach to get there.

I've generally been a Loreal 5A Med Ash brown with about 10-20% grey since my early 20s. Now that Im 40 it caught up. I had shaved my head for some medical stuff last year and when it grew back it was 40% grey. Yikes. So I really wanted a smokey blonde to combat the excess grey that grew in.

Results: when I dyed my naturally 5A and White (40% greys) I got an orangey ombre type look on my new virgin natural hair. I then decided to wait a couple weeks, bleach it with the Hyper Platinum Feria lift and ended up with a silvery ash blonde / light ash brown highlighted effect like on the box.

Not sure how long before the stage coach turns into a pumpkin and the color fades and the greys come through and I look like I'm 80 - but for now I'm happy. At least it grew back!

You must use this on bleached or very light hair. It will turn a 5 level brown brassy, so keep that in mind. You'll need to bleach if you're that dark to get the look on the box. It works quite well if you mind the directions or bleach first.

profile.title: No instructions were provided in English & no indication of ingredients
profile.text:
Without instructions or an indication of ingredients, I am frightened to use this product on my face... does it burn? How long should I leave it on for? Is it just soap and water to wash it off. I am not doubting the efficacy of the product but it is not high quality if there are no instructions.

*** Update ***
I have used this product twice so far & I am not noticing anything. That said, I don't have acne or other major skin issues. I bought this product to see if it would help with mild greasy pores, which I assume is quite normal. No noticeable change.

For me It did irritate the skin where the skin is most sensitive or thin. Specifically, I felt burning & had small patches of redness in and around my nose. If you buy this product I recommend keeping it away from areas of thin skin like nose, eyelids, etc.

From a value for money perspective, this product is meh! Doesn't help beyond soap and water. My kids do get a kick out of the green face...so maybe it is a better entertainment product than a beauty product!

The next day it looks and feels dirty and crunchy. Very weird, I like the immediate results, but I am not a wash my hair every day person. I need something that makes my hair smell and feel clean for longer than a single day.
As for the scent that is there it is very faint and reminiscent of no name brand baby lotion, not the good stuff, you know what I mean. If you’re in need of a shampoo that has little to no scent then you may love this shampoo. I will keep it and use it, but I don’t think I will buy it again. Now that Shine salt scrub is a different story but I will have to review that elsewhere.

profile.title: Great option for dry/sensitive eyes!
profile.text:
I rate this a 10/10 for dry or sensitive eyes. I have extremely dry/painful eyes and this is the only mascara I’ve been able to tolerate. This mascara is so light and gentle that my eyes actually feel bare and I forget I’m wearing any eye makeup at all!

Pros:
- No crumbles, clumps, or flakes
- Shiny, smooth, gel-like appearance
- Comfortable and non-irritating
- Very natural looking

Cons:
- No noticeable lift or curl
- Doesn’t add very much length
- Smudges easily

Overall, I think this mascara is great, especially if you suffer from dry eyes!

Currently, this is the only mascara my eyes can tolerate, so even though I wish it gave me a little bit more length, I’m just so grateful that I can finally wear some form of eye makeup again! :)

profile.title: Applies nicely... but
profile.text:
I have been searching for a really good mascara for a little while now. I have always been a fan of Maybelline's Colossal mascara, but they decided to change up the formula a while back and it's just not the same, especially the waterproof one.

Decided to give this one a shot and here is what I have found so far:

1. It's definitely not waterproof, so if you have any kind of allergies and watery eyes, beware, it will smudge all over the place.
2. It applies nicely. Gives even coverage on the lashes without weighing them down with too much product. I would say it is mostly true to the name of length and lift as it does do both, just don't be expecting to look like you have false lashes on.
3. The wand brush is a little more streamlined compared to that of the Colossal, which I think helps with the lifting and lengthening. Depending on how you like your lashes to look, a coat or two with this and you're good to go.
4. Durability - here is where I had somewhat of an issue. I apply my makeup in the morning before work (even with working from home I never know when I will have an impromptu video call, so I'm always prepared). This usually occurs shortly before 7am and I need my makeup to last me ALL DAY because I usually don't get around to washing it off until 10-11pm. What I have found with the Almay is that even though it goes on nice and evenly, half way through my day I start to find my lashes feeling weighed down and notice they start clumping together. I thought it was odd, so decided to try again the next day to see what happened and sure enough, same thing. I don't know if it's just due to the formula or what but that has been my experience.
5. Washes off very easily. I use coconut oil to remove my makeup and then use my cleanser to completely wash my face and I haven't had any issues with removal.

Since I do actually like the product aside from it's durability, I've decided to play around with it and see if I can get it to wear a little better. What I've been experimenting with is applying this first to add length and then apply my waterproof mascara to sort of set them both (and so it gives me the waterproof protection I need) and it seems to be holding up when used this way. Can't say what the real issue is with why this doesn't wear well all day.. is it me or is it the product itself..who knows? I don't hate it at all, just wish it would wear better.

Hope this helps!
